lead_paragraph: About 70 counties and cities in Florida have passed ordinances to ban or oppose fracking, even as the State Legislature considers a bill that would overrule them.

headline.print_headline: Local-State Conflict on Fracking Heats Up in Geologically Fragile Florida
headline.main: Unlikely Battle Over Fracking Intensifies in Florida

snippet: About 70 counties and cities in Florida have passed ordinances to ban or oppose fracking, even as the State Legislature considers a bill that would overrule them.
abstract: Conflict over hydraulic fracturing, also known as fracking, is intensifying across Florida, where almost 80 cities and counties have banned method of extracting natural gas and oil; state bill attempting to regulate fracking is dividing Legislature, with environmentalists and local officials expressing concerns that measure could keep local governments from passing ordinances prohibiting process.
